etymologies: modern Latin, named after Benjamin P. Gloxin, the 18th-century German botanist who first described it

definitions: a tropical American plant with large, velvety, bell-shaped flowers.

notes.text: Genera Gloxinia and Sinningia, family Gesneriaceae: several species, in particular the florists' gloxinia (S. speciosa), which is a popular houseplant

shortDefinitions: tropical American plant with large, velvety, bell-shaped flowers
